Get recommended discriminant parameters for production use

Source: R/excellent_discriminants.R
get_recommended_discriminants.Rd

Selects a subset of excellent discriminants based on specified criteria. Provides three selection strategies: highest scores, balanced test performance, or diverse parameter ranges.

Usage

get_recommended_discriminants(
  n = 10,
  results_file = "discriminant_analysis_results/raw_results.rds",
  criteria = "top_score"
)

Arguments

n

Number of discriminants to return (default: 10)

results_file

Path to the analysis results RDS file (default: "discriminant_analysis_results/raw_results.rds")

criteria

Selection criteria, one of:

"top_score"

Select discriminants with highest overall scores

"balanced"

Select discriminants that pass all tests uniformly

"diverse"

Select discriminants with diverse parameter ranges using k-means clustering

Value

A data frame with recommended discriminant parameters containing:

a, b, c

Discriminant parameters

discriminant

The discriminant value b² - 4ac

overall_score

Combined test score

Test results

Individual test pass/fail status

balance_score

For "balanced" criteria, the proportion of tests passed

Details

Selection strategies:

  • top_score: Simply returns the n highest-scoring discriminants

  • balanced: Prioritizes discriminants that pass all tests equally well, then sorts by overall score

  • diverse: Uses k-means clustering on normalized (a,b,c) parameters to ensure diverse parameter combinations, selecting the best from each cluster

If fewer excellent discriminants exist than requested, returns all available with a warning.

Note

The "diverse" criteria requires at least 3 discriminants and uses k-means clustering with seed=42 for reproducibility.

See also

load_excellent_discriminants, create_excellent_prng_config

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Get top 10 discriminants by score
top10 <- get_recommended_discriminants(n = 10, criteria = "top_score")

# Get discriminants with balanced test performance
balanced <- get_recommended_discriminants(n = 5, criteria = "balanced")

# Get diverse parameter combinations
diverse <- get_recommended_discriminants(n = 20, criteria = "diverse")
} # }
